page.title: 08HISTORIC CHURCHES
page.content: Except for a few incorporated stones, nothing remains of the Saxon Churchyard mentioned in the first Domesday Book, as contained within the hill_top moated manor of Udimore. There is some evidence that the Normans rebuilt in a cruciform patternand that the three piers embedded on the south wall originally led into a south transept, since demolished. With the popularity of the manor in Edward 1's time there was greater prosperity and the whole church was extended to almost double its length with a long chancel. .The church was virtually rebuilt 1220 _ 1260 in the Early English style, as it remains today. At the end of the 19th /century single lancet windows were pierced through the north nave wall as part of an extensive restoration.
